column4: can anyone tell me if i share my desktop with a windows pc? remote desktop
anyone using the Enlightenment desktop?
is it recommended or not really?
its doesn't have anywhere near the number of developers as kde/gnome. which translates into very few releases.. not many users.
.. 12 months and you'll start seeing more eye candy become available.  XGL/Glitz/Cairo/Luminocity(Metacity really) are all working on providing it for us.
what is eye candy? the plastic look, cos i dont dig that bru
lemme find a url for you.
http://www.gnome.org/~seth/blog/xshots
i installed and played around with luminocity .. pretty neat.. not really usable for daily computer use though
appreciated
that is pretty neat, but i can see that if i installed that on a company's pcs they would throw me out
speed is the essential part
its a test bed.. to should you what IS possible.. not what will be the default :)
as in.. if it can do that.. it'll beable to do 'xxxx'
well its cool. i never doubted that linux is capable of anything.
does it dicrease speed?
it uses your video cards GL rendering engine.. so no.
but lemme repeat .. its all experimental :) .. i have installed and used it. and it does make stuff slower.. but thats just bugs in the code :)
how long in ur opinion until its ready?
the cairo/glitz/xgl stuff is neat as well.  i think the first distro you'll see it in will be novell's .. early next year.
what suse?
yeah or whatever they call it now.
lol, so ubuntu isnt going for that stuff?
www.osnews.com has various articles talking about it.
